title: query_as! macro does not use column alias on master (0.4.0-pre)
body:
On master (0.4.0-pre) if you do a query like

    query_as!(Customer, "SELECT customer.name AS customer_name FROM customer;")

With a struct `Customer` that contains the field `customer_name`, compilation fails because it seems to look for the `name` column in the struct instead of `customer_name`.

I created a small repo for the bug https://github.com/blackwolf12333/rust_sqlx_bug. To reproduce you probably want to modify the Cargo.toml to point to the right sqlx directory and I'm assuming this will fail on any database but I only tested with the mysql feature. The table description and data can be found in setup.sql.

Actual compilation error:

> error: error returned from database: 1054 (42S22): Unknown column 'customer.name' in 'field list'
  --> src/main.rs:18:41
   |
18 |       let customer_names: Vec<Customer> = sqlx::query_as!(
   |  _________________________________________^
19 |          Customer,
20 |          "SELECT
21 |              customer.name AS customer_name
22 |          FROM
23 |              customers"
24 |      )
   | _____^
   |
   = note: this error originates in a macro (in Nightly builds, run with -Z macro-backtrace for more info)
error: aborting due to previous error
error: could not compile `rust_sqlx_bug`.
To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
